text: Having issues with Modules being added to global groups and not showing up on any pages. I've tried flushing cache on my screen, viewing on another browser, and adding query strings.. I'm at a loss. Anyone else seeing similar issues?
Do you mind messaging me a link and what you’re trying to accomplish?
But even when i changed this value and made it zero, it still gave me the same code.  Overall, I am still trying to figure out the analytics issue and this was one avenue I was exploring.
Since canonical URLs are no longer being generated automatically in HS, can we please have this moved out of advanced options and placed below the blog url in the settings area?
Also, apparently you cannont paste the full url of the blog in there and can only use relative paths correct? (unless its a different domain alltogether then you can add it in)
another question on this, since this is removed now, are there any plans to remove the {{canonical_url}} variable from the JSON data?
So it looks like the Canonical URL field in settings doesnt even save to the JSON Dev Info anywhere, can we get this added into that area so we can use it as a HubL variable
<@U22PU4G4A> <@U22PJPGK0> any thoughts?
old
Adding <@U3VN3LMME> here. He is the Product Manager for our Blog.
Thanks Jeff, <@U3VN3LMME> if you want to discuss further, feel free to PM me
Hey AJ, we’re actually releasing a modification to that feature later today that’s going to set self-referencing canonical URLs by default on pages and blog posts (like it was before).
does that solve your problem?
Yep, that solves the issues for sure, this is awesome if its going back to the old way
awesome. We built a setting for anyone who wants to set it the way it’s currently set up as well instead of forcing you through one way or another
Thanks - I was able to reproduce it. Looking into it now
Is anyone having cloudfare issues with their HubSpot hosted website?
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

I'm having a weird issue: normally I can safely manipulate CTA buttons in a $(window).on('load') function, but somehow the CTAs are now loading after the window load event which I didn't think was possible. I'm having to set a timeout function with an additional 1.5 seconds which only sometimes manipulates them. Any ideas how they could load after page load?
How about `$(document).ready()`

Nope tried that too. To my understanding $(window).on('load') happens even after $(document).ready() and waits for all images and scripts to load first, so it's weird that the CTA button scripts that append them to the document seemingly aren't being covered here.
You can put a breakpoint in your function and see what the page looks like when it is called
We’re pushing a fix for this shortly.
to add to that <@U6KTCR3B3> if you add the line debugger; onto the line in you JS you'll be able to stop there
I'm trying it out! See what I can find. Thanks for the help. So far this only makes sense to me if the CTAs happened to load asynchronously, but it doesn't look like that's the case.
if you dno't mind sharing the page, I can take a quick look
I always target ctas on window load
<@U22PNRAJD> <@U22PWJ41G> is the new search going to work with HubDB Data?
if not any solutions you know of that will?
If you are referring to HubDB Dynamic pages, yes, it should index those dynamic pages
as far as other content, I would imagine that it would as if it index dynamic pages, then normal pages using HubDB should work as well
great thanks
now i need a beta release date. i need it for a project :slightly_smiling_face:
i think they are currently in the process of opening up the beta to public. <@U6GNQ7JBU> might be able to add you in unless the signup page is up
It is open to all portals in alpha
I’m not sure where <@U2H3TT8F2> gets his information, but he’s correct :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://gph.is/1KjihQe>
you should change your script to $(this).outerHeight()
you also want to clear out your array elements after you make the change
ctaHeights = [];
after setting the height
<@U6KTCR3B3> sorry this took a minute I ended up getting involved in a meeting that took a little longer
and you also need to clear out the height so they don't keep goign crazy
personally i worked on a sameheight script,  <https://gist.github.com/NickDeckerDevs/9135ea9116dbd5081a001115b18b15f3>
<@U25PYL3Q8> shared a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9GLCN613/equalheight-revisited.js|equalheight-revisited.js>
and then I run loadAndResize() on the window load / resize
BUT I don't use that anymore
I use this: <https://github.com/liabru/jquery-match-height>
when you get into resizign stuff it can be pretty crazy what you need to target and I foudn this script does a good job

<@U7SL518D6> commented on <@U25PYL3Q8>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9GLCN613/equalheight-revisited.js|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9GLCN613/equalheight-revisited.js>: In the spirit of randomly posting equal heights code:

```display:flex;
align-items:stretch;
flex-flow:row-wrap;
/*add prefixes because well you just should*/```
yeah for sure, flexbox too, prefixes are annoying to me!

btw, as long as you prefix - using flexbox is pretty safe to use now. Think it goes back to IE10 last i checked.  At our company we officially dropped support for IE 9 unless clients specifically ask for us to have it.
haha awesome!
So I know the Hubl/Custom HTML module thing has been beaten to death, but has anyone else had errors with old templates that have Custom HTML modules with Hubl in them?
We are not able to clone templates to another portal due to this error and I'm concerned our marketplace templates now all need to be revised
